intro: Hibbertia gracilipes, commonly known as the slender hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and small, showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open habitats such as heathlands and woodlands. Hibbertia gracilipes produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and vibrant floral display.
